Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant meets the tri-partite test for a stay of removal
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review of PRRA decision and motion for stay of removal
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's credibility undermined by misrepresentations and fabricated stories
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Affidavits, PRRA submissions, past legal records
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Tri-partite test (irreparable harm, serious issue to be tried, balance of convenience)
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Alleged risk upon return to India
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Tri-partite test for stay of removal
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of irreparable harm, lack of serious issue, public interest favoring removal
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Motion for stay of removal following judicial review
Crimes.Regulation_Cited: IRPA provisions related to removal and PRRA
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to provide sufficient evidence for irreparable harm
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Balance of convenience, irreparable harm, serious issue to be tried
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Clean hands doctrine and tri-partite test
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Reasonableness of PRRA decision and eligibility for stay
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness for PRRA; correctness/patent unreasonableness for stay
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Tri-partite test for stay of removal
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Denial of stay and continuation of removal
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: History of immigration fraud and lack of credible risk evidence
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient evidence of irreparable harm, lack of corroboration
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Applicant had opportunity to present case in PRRA and court
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Fabricated stories and false documentation implied
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claim of risk upon return to India
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Timeliness and burden of proof in stay applications
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to disclose or substantiate key facts

Crimes.Crime_Name: Misrepresentation under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant meets the tri-partite test for a stay of removal
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review of PRRA decision and motion for stay
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA sections on removal and admissibility

Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Tri-partite test for stay of removal
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Public interest, lack of irreparable harm, no serious issue raised
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Motion for stay following PRRA judicial review
Crimes.Regulation_Cited: IRPA s. 44, s. 164, and related regulations
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to meet burden of proof for stay criteria
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Irreparable harm, serious issue, balance of convenience
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Statutory interpretation of IRPA and equitable stay principles
Crimes.Application_Factor: Admission of fraudulent behavior and exclusion order history
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Lawfulness of PRRA decision and justification for stay
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness for PRRA; discretionary equitable standard for stay
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA provisions on misrepresentation and removal
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: History of misrepresentation and failure to prove risk
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of credible, verifiable evidence supporting harm claims
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Applicant had full opportunity in PRRA and court process
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Pattern of dishonesty in immigration applications
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Humanitarian and compassionate considerations, risk claims
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Burden and timing of stay applications
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to disclose true circumstances in immigration applications

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant satisfies the tri-partite test for a stay of removal
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review of PRRA decision and motion for stay
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Severely undermined due to marriage fraud and prior misrepresentations
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA provisions on spousal sponsorship and misrepresentation

Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Tri-partite test: irreparable harm, serious issue, balance of convenience
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of credible evidence, public interest in enforcing removal

Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to substantiate claims with reliable evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Unverified and vague allegations in affidavits

Crimes.Application_Factor: Exclusion order based on marriage fraud
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Validity of PRRA decision and need for equitable relief
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness for PRRA; discretionary review for stay

Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Weak affidavits, lack of third-party corroboration
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Applicant had access to PRRA and court proceedings
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Pattern of deception including fabricated relationships
